title.rendered: Trent vs London, Men’s 100 League: Pitch Report, Playing XIs, Fantasy Team & Top Picks

content.rendered:
Pitch Report for Trent vs London

1st innings average score: 162

2nd innings average score: 151

Nature: Easy pitch to bat on. Shorter boundary on one side.

Time: August 20, 11.30 PM IST

Fantasy Cricket Team Suggestions for Trent vs London

We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable Playing XI for Trent & London

Probable Playing XI for Trent: Alex Hales, Dawid Malan, Tom Kohler-Cadmore (wk), Tom Moores, Colin Munro, Samit Patel, Lewis Gregory (c), Daniel Sams, Luke Wood, Sam Cook, Tabraiz Shamsi

Probable Playing XI for London: Daniel Bell-Drummond, Adam Rossington(w), Glenn Maxwell, Daniel Lawrence, Eoin Morgan(c), Kieron Pollard, Liam Dawson, Jordan Thompson, Nathan Ellis, Mason Crane, Brad Wheal

Also Read:

India vs Zimbabwe Fantasy Cricket Tips for 2nd ODI

Asia cup 2022 Schedule

Birmingham vs Northern Fantasy Cricket Tips

How to save yourself from losing during a fantasy cricket contest

Oval vs Birmingham Fantasy Tips

Fantasy Power Picks for the Match

Amidst two single-digit scores, Dawid Malan has also blasted consecutive unbeaten knocks of 88 and 98, owing to which he is the leading run-scorer (241 at an average of 80 in 5 innings) of the tournament.

His opening partner Alex Hales too has been on fire. By accumulating 199 runs, including 2 fifties in 5 innings, he is the third-highest leading run-getter. He averages an impressive 40.

133 runs. 3 wickets. 4 catches. Glenn Maxwell has lived up to his billing of a true all-rounder in the 4 games that he has been a part of. Simply put, he has been a huge asset in fantasy leagues.

Smart Fantasy Picks for the Match

After picking consecutive three-wicket hauls to kick start the tournament, Daniel Sams has gone wicketless in his last three games. However, he did make amends with the bat by scoring a 25-ball 55 against Birmingham a few days ago.

Barring one match, where he scored 13, Samit Patel hasn’t got any opportunities with the bat in this edition. That said, he has rewarded the fantasy players by consistently picking wickets (6 in 5 games).

Kieron Pollard is yet to bowl in this league, but he has let his bat alone do the talking. His scores read 19*, 34*, and 26*. Talk about game-changers down the order!

Eoin Morgan might have retired from international cricket, but he has shown no signs of rust in this competition. He has scores of 47, 37, 1, and 5*. His unconventional strokes are tailor-made for the 100 league.

Tabraiz Shamsi might have picked only 3 wickets in 4 games, but his gutsy style of bowling, coupled with the required urgency in the format, always keeps him in the hunt.

Much of London’s success this season should be attributed to the wicket-taking abilities of Jordan Thompson and Mason Crane. While Thompson has bagged 9 wickets, including the best figures of 4 for 21, Crane has 6 to his credit, including the best figures of 2 for 21.

As far as wicketkeeper selection for this contest goes, Adam Rossington pips Tom Kohler-Cadmore. While Rossington has added 88 runs and inflicted 4 dismissals with the gloves, Cadmore has collected only 55 runs to go with 3 dismissals.

Fantasy Tip Of The Day

Picking the in-form Trent openers, the match-winning all-rounders from London, and their leading bowlers for this round of fantasy cricket will be advantageous. Remember that both sides are on top and therefore, it is important to create a balanced team.
